note:
Solarpunk Presents is a podcast that explores the people and projects working on bringing us a better world today.

Solarpunk is more than just an idea, more than just an aesthetic. Those inspire us, but where do we go from there? Hosts Ariel Kroon and Christina De La Rocha are producing podcast episodes featuring interviews with people working to make the world a better place right now. Join us as we explore what #solarpunk looks like in the present.

note:
Radical #Leftist, #Hippie, and happy partner and parent of a couple of wild children.

Avid #Reader of anything weird and fun, with a slight lean towards #SciFi and #Fantasy #Books. #Neurodivergent several different ways. I'm not too bad at pool (#Billiards) and #Bowling, but haven't had time to enjoy either in several years.

As for work, I'm a computer generalist -- equal parts #Sysadmin, #NetworkAdmin, #CyberSecurity and #NetworkSecurity engineer and a dabbling novice #Coder. Have been working as a senior engineer at a small #MSP for several years, necessitating the wearing of many hats. And after a quarter century in the industry, I still *love* and enjoy my career.

note: Author of "How To Win Jobs & Influence Germans". #solarpunk #EuropeanRepublic

The space to discuss Solarpunk itself and Solarpunk related stuff that doesn’t fit elsewhere.

Join our chat: Movim or XMPP client.

What is Solarpunk? Why does it matter?

In this series we discuss Solarpunk as a movement within art, literature, and activism. We explore its themes and talk about what separates it from its genre peers. Each episode explores a writing prompt set in a Solarpunk aesthetic with examples and inspirations from our world today.

Based upon story prompts created by Paweł Ngei⁩.

Episode transcripts available here

New logo and cover image by Natalia Vish (CC-BY-SA 4.0)
#Journalism prof at CUNY's Newmark School. Author of THE GUTENBERG PARENTHESIS & OBJECT LESSONS: MAGAZINE upcoming from Bloomsbury. Cohost of This Week in Google on the TWiT network.
